alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 7:03AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern DeKalb County through 730 AM CDT... At 702 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Crossville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Crossville, Geraldine, Lebanon, Dog Town, Hopewell, Arona, Rodentown, Skirum, Lathamville and Little River Canyon NP. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
